column5: Just getting the 2 little guys ready for the final day of Simcoe ice going off Innisfil, hopefully some perch-I'll get some pics up with a bit of luck.
good luck out there....it's always a great day when the kids get out  with you
God Luck! I expect a report just choke full of pictures!  G
Well -we went we drilled -we conquered the mighty yellow perch, had fun with the little guys-mission accomplished!  now lets get this stuff melted ASAP and get some real fishin in!
Great stuff Mark ! One happy camper there...

Thats one very happy camper there Bud! The smile is a..... M   I   L  E       W  I   D   E..! WTG...........Its great when they're that age....... Problem...when they start to loose interst (as they got older) it hurt and it puzzled me big time... It was truly painful.....Funny thing tho..... Seems once they got over the teenage years....they just sorta came back to it. Well, ..some it took til the age of 23 or so. Anyhoo Bud........looked like a great day our with Dad and the lads...WTG Take care and Dang man.........we'll speak soon. Looking forward to it. pete

The picture of the young lad with the perch reminded me of the times Dad would take my brother and me perch fishing off Viginia beach. We had an old hut and could see them bite as the water was only 8ft. deep. That was 52 years ago and I'm still "hooked on Lake Simcoe fishing today! Hope the same thing happens to your boys.

I see that my little buddy Bradley was on them hard again! I wish that I was out with you guys but then Trevor would probably steal my fish!  Glad to see that you had a good time Mark, now get back to work and get pouring!!!!! Cheers, Dave
